Job Description

Olympus is hiring an Analytics Business Partner to join the Analytics & Reporting team who will deliver support to our market leading medical systems group. In this role, the incumbent will work cross functionally with multiple groups, including sales and marketing, as well as members of the Analytics & Reporting team, to deliver insights that help guide business decisions and support go-forward strategies.  The development and tracking of key performance indicators will be critical to enhance the understanding of the business and improve data based decision making.  They will work on projects that range from segmentation and targeting initiatives to sales promotion analysis and data visualization/dashboarding creation.  They will enjoy figuring out how to automate solutions in applications such as Salesforce.com, SAP Business Objects and Qlik.  The Analytics Business Partner will gather requirements from sales and marketing teams, develop solutions and conduct quantitative analysis of data results to make recommendations to leadership teams.  They will take the lead in collaborating with other teams as needed to produce the most effective solution.  They will feel comfortable taking initiative, consider themselves a self-starter and understand the importance of data integrity and providing excellent customer service to the team they support.

This role will report to the manager of Analytics and Reporting and be a member of the MSG Sales Operations team at Olympus, which is comprised of four groups: Professional Services, Analytics & Reporting, Salesforce Enablement and Compensation Effectiveness. All of these teams are bound together through a mission to turn data into actionable insights that our internal and external customers can use to make better decisions.

Job Duties

  • Identify and implement innovative analytic frameworks and solutions to facilitate strategic business decisions, identify new market opportunities and uncover areas of improvement.
  • Provide ROI analysis of marketing initiatives and targeted sales activities.
  • Engage with project sponsors and stakeholders to understand each business initiative.  Probe for hidden questions and goals. Bring structure to each request and translate requirements into an analytic approach.
  • Work with Product Management to identify target customers for marketing/sales initiatives by focusing on segmentation exercises. Work with Salesforce.com team to integrate target lists into CRM as new sales leads; monitor sales performance against target lists.
  • Understand relationships between front end applications and data repositories.  Ensure quality of the source information/data that is relied upon by management in their decision making.
  • Analyze marketing and sales metrics to identify cause-effect relationships between market/customer actions and financial outcomes in order to increase profitability.
  • Build dashboards with Business Intelligence tools such as the SAP Business Objects tool set (Webi, Design Studio and Lumira) and Qlik to visualize key performance indicators for specific customers, products and/or promotions.
  • Work directly with and interview sales representatives and customers in order to inform effectiveness of strategies and uncover potential strategic/tactical opportunities.
  • Educate and train users regarding the functional use of analyses, reports and other tools.
  • Advise leadership on how BI and Analytics come together (processes, practices and technologies) to play a critical role in improving data based decision making. Lead communication and presentation of all findings

Job Qualifications

Required:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, Math, Statistics, Information Technology, Computer Science or related field
  • Minimum of 6 – 9 years with Bachelor’s Degree; minimum of 4-7 with Master’s Degree.
  • Report development experience in Business Intelligence tools such as Qlik or SAP Business Objects is required.
  • Ability to travel domestically if projects require.

Preferred:

  • Strong analytic and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent writing and communication skills
  • Self-directed individual with ability to multi-task on concurrent projects
  • Extensive experience with Microsoft applications (i.e. PowerPoint, Excel, Access)
  • Relational database/SQL experience highly desired
  • Highly organized, detail-oriented, results-driven

Why join Olympus?

Here, people matter—our health, our happiness, and our lives.

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Visions coverage effective on start date
  • 24/7 Employee Assistance Program
  • Free virtual live and on-demand wellness classes
  • Work-life balance supportive culture with hybrid and remote roles
  • 12 Paid Holidays
  • Educational Assistance
  • Parental Leave and Adoption Assistance
  • Volunteering and charitable donation match programs
  • Diversity & Inclusion Programs including Colleague Affinity Networks
  • On-Site Child Daycare, Café, Fitness Center**

Job Description

The Product Marketing Specialist, Urology will report directly to the Director of Marketing (Stone Devices & Lithotripsy). This role will be responsible for all aspects of the product life cycle including: upstream input to new product development, new product launch and managing the post launch business.

As part of the marketing team, the Product Marketing Specialist will participate in the development of annual and strategic marketing and business plans, develop and execute marketing and sales programs to achieve revenue and income targets, and interface with customers, sales representatives, and in-house stakeholders in support of the business.

Job Duties

  • Participate in the development of long and short-term marketing strategies and plans to increase revenue, maximize profit and grow/maintain market share.
  • Manage the Urology Stone portfolio including Access Sheaths, Guidewires, Balloons, Retrieval devices, Stents and the ShockPulse Dual Action Lithotripsy device.
  • Support the development of annual and long-term corporate strategic plans.
  • Provide input to R&D during product review meetings, share customer needs and market trends, provide feedback on new product prototypes and create product forecasts.
  • Create the value proposition positioning statement, key messages and sales representative talk tracks for products they support.
  • Create sales collateral including product brochures, technical reports, advertising, videos, case reports, clinical papers, and sales training materials.
  • Responsible for new product launches and maintenance of their existing product portfolio.
  • Develop the launch strategy and lead the internal launch team to ensure successful product launch is on schedule and within budget.
  • Track and evaluate product performance and sales results post launch including: Product performance and customer feedback through field visits and cadence calls.
  • Evaluate product positioning and messaging for revisions and updates.
  • Share best-selling practices with sales organization and R&D.
  • Monitor and evaluate competitive response to new product introduction and existing products.
  • Manage key HCP (healthcare professional) relationships in compliance with Olympus code of ethics and compliance guidelines.
  • Act as the product and procedure expert to drive large account conversions.
  • Organize and lead sessions during the National Sales Meeting to ensure the field sales organization is fully trained on the product and prepared to execute product level strategies.
  • Organize and prepare for critical Urology tradeshows to highlight Olympus products including AUA and regional shows as requested.
  • Meet with HCPs to understand trends and obtain product feedback
  • Assess competitor activities and how to position Olympus for success. Perform other related duties as assigned.

Job Requirements

Required:

  • BA/BS in Marketing or related field is required.
  • Ability to interact with field personnel management and customers.
  • Individual must possess a high degree of self-reliance, initiative, and creativity.
  • Ability to interpret trends and data translating the information into actions and improvements.
  • Must be willing to travel (domestic and international) as required (generally 15-25%).
  • Work flexible hours as required

Preferred:

  • Minimum of 1-2 years of industry experience in sales/marketing/commercial execution is preferred.
  • Experience in healthcare and/or medical devices is preferred
  • Experience in developing and managing physician / surgeon KOLs is preferred
  • Project Management experience is preferred
  • Excellent written and verbal communication as well as interpersonal skills at all levels.
  • Strong communication skills both written and verbal.
  • Demonstrated ability to present and interact with various levels of management
  • Organization, analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • High degree of personal organization.

Job Description

This position is responsible for managing a team of Order Support Representatives and Team Leads who support various types of order processing for Olympus customers sales representatives and other related departments.

Job Duties

  • Manage a team of Order Support Reps and Team Leads.
  • Track, analyze and report on daily KPIs (orders processed pending new etc.) for individuals and for the entire team. Identify performance issues and address as needed.
  • Monitor quantity of requests from internal and external customers in multiple inboxes and direct Order Support Reps (OSR) from multiple Olympus locations to each inbox as required.
  • Ensure that team successfully completes all training as it relates to ERP/CRM and other systems.
  • Monitor and document performance of OSRs (includes daily KPIs data accuracy call quality email quality etc.). Highlight strengths and address issues as appropriate. Work with employees on professional development.
  • Serve as escalation for Order Support Team Leads by providing guidance and/or coordinating to find a solution with internal and external customers. Establish processes and solutions that fit within company policies procedures and guidelines.
  • Assist with the development and training of Customer and Sales Support training programs and continuous improvement for both new hires and on-going process changes. Additionally assist with the development updating and training as it pertains to corporate policies; J-Sox QSP's etc.
  • Other duties as assigned

Job Qualifications

Required:

  • Associate's degree (or equivalent Customer Service Knowledge) or Military.
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in a Customer Service Sales Support or supervisory position in a Customer Service Sales Support or Sales Operations environment is required.
  • Other Considerations (travel/hours availability etc.): Occasional overnight travel may be required; ability to independently travel as needed for training or meetings. Must be flexible to work all shifts which may include evenings weekends and holidays.

Preferred:

  • Prioritizing and Organizing Work: Allocates time and attention based on what is the most important to achieve key goals and objectives; approaches work in an organized and systematic manner; effectively manages tasks information and requests redirects resources and activities to overcome setbacks and shortfalls.
  • Championing Customer Needs: Calls attention to issues that impact customer satisfaction; views thing from the perspective of customers; acting within corporate polices to promote a positive and timely customer experience. Consistently reviews electronic processes several times a day to ensure that system and processes or tools are functioning as expected. Will escalate and work with ITS as needed to resolve operating malfunctions to ensure customer satisfaction and that our organizational goals are met.
  • Using Computers and Technology: Adept at understanding vendor/customer processes and systems (EDI WAWF Lease) and other forms of technology related to his/her job; keeps up to date on technological changes; adapts work approach to keep pace with innovations in technology.
  • Strong organizational/time management skills Strong interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent detail/problem solving skills.
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks.
  • Excellent verbal/written communication skills.
  • Detail oriented and ability to prioritize.

Job Description

Provides equipment training, clinical case support, education, as well as knowledge and expertise in the sale and marketing of Ultrasound products and to the improvement of those products.

Job Duties

  • Assists the sales organization in demonstrating and selling all ultrasound products by providing the technical expertise of ultrasound
  • Provides the technical expertise in installation of customer products and provides extended on-site support and/or training to customers as appropriate after installation
  • Troubleshoots, identifies and corrects as possible and appropriate, any equipment related adjustments, functions, or problems. First tries to troubleshoot over the phone prior to going on site. Initiates Technical Support, repair or other appropriate response to any issue beyond the Specialist’s clinical expertise.
  • Provides training to Olympus personnel as required, using appropriate training materials and methods to support the Sales Training and/or Marketing Departments.
  • Supports customer education courses and activities related to the clinical usage of ultrasound products.  Participates at meetings, shows, and conventions as required, to demonstrate and promote ultrasound products.
  • Reports any problems, needs, ideas, etc. related to product and or techniques to the appropriate Product or R&D Manager.
  • Maintains working relationships with all levels of the sales organization and other support functions, such as customer service and repair, operations, field service engineering and administration.
  • Establishes and maintains relationships with physicians, nursing management and personnel and other associated personnel at the customer level.
  • Develops and maintains effective knowledge of competitive products and provides input to management.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.

Job Qualifications

Required:

  • Registered Diagnostic Medical Sonographer, RDMS required. Radiology Technologist, RT(R) a plus. Maintains all certification and/or registrations.
  • Registered in at least two modalities, one of which should be Abdominal (others may include Vascular, Cardiac, OB/GYN, etc.)
  • Previous business experience in product demonstration, installation, and usage instruction
  • Minimum of three years clinical applications experience in ultrasound.
  • Must be able to travel extensively.

Preferred:

  • Bachelor’s degree in related field preferred
  • Gastroenterology background useful and preferred.
  • Ability to effectively communicate and educate physicians, nursing and sales personnel essential
  • High level of personal organization
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • High level of customer interaction and customer service support
  • Independent work ethic
  • Individual and team oriented
  • Consistently exceeds customer satisfaction and expectations of both internal and external customers

Job Description

As the Product Manager for Service, you will be responsible for developing the marketing strategy and day-to-day activities that communicate the value Olympus delivers through maximum uptime to internal and external customers. You will develop and execute marketing goals and tactics to support this mission and achieve business objectives and financial targets. You will work as a liaison between Service Marketing and other groups Including those within Service and Product Management to ensure smooth collaboration and service readiness for new product launches.

Job Duties

  • Develop and execute integrated marketing plans that focus on the advantage of OEM Service and the value provided to the customer.  Build relationships with the sales force and other internal stakeholders to achieve smooth execution. Ensure stakeholder alignment is received for key Service Marketing initiatives.
  • Support the sales team(s) through regular training and communication that enables them to successfully sell service to their customers. Create training presentations, tools, and conduct sales training for sales training classes and the National Sales Training Meetings
  • Create targeted materials and messaging for the various customer audiences.  Develop a communications plan to touch these audiences and execute it.
  • Create actionable plans to improve product-contract attachment rates to secure multiyear business and ensure that customers receive maximum uptime.
  • Monitor market trends, competitive activity, and emerging technologies that have the ability to impact Service Delivery.
  • Work with product management for your assigned Business Unit(s) to ensure their product launch timing, needs, and repair requirements are communicated to the Service and Repair teams.
  • Develop and recommend programs, new packages/products, and pricing for Service offerings.
  • Gather customer insights and voice of customers by attending trade shows, visiting customers, and using other means.
  • Support and host customer visits to Olympus locations in San Jose, CA and/or Bartlett, TN.
  • Employ analytical methods to educate Salesforce on how to target customer base and increase penetration rates.

Job Qualifications

Required:

  • Bachelor's degree in Marketing or related field is required.
  • Must be willing to travel domestically as required (maximum of 30%)

Preferred:

  • Minimum of three (3) years of product management or marketing, healthcare marketing preferred.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication, as well as presentation skills
  • Proven ability to interpret trends and data, translating the information into actions and improvements

Job Description

This position carries significant responsibility and relies on both collections and customer service experience and judgment to accomplish and meet customers needs and Olympus s compliance and delinquency expectations. This position provides a continuous point of contact with Olympus Sales, Product Managers and Third Party Vendors and will serve as the central point in resolving all Demo asset returns related issues. Additionally, as the compliance landscape has changed this position will work closely with the Compliance Department.

The Asset Retrieval Administrator is responsible for:

  • The retrieval management of assigned accounts related to the thousands of assets under all Olympus Demo inventory. Olympus Demo inventory include but are not limited to: Cental Demo, Core Demo, Marketing, Product Loans, Grants, Tradeshows, Workshops, and any other programs that may fall under the Asset Management group.
  • The coordination and administration of the Olympus Centralized Asset Return Process. This duty requires coordinating the return logistics with Reps, Product Managers, Third Party Vendors to ensure assets are returned to Olympus as quickly and cost effectively as possible.
  • All customer service and Asset collection activities within his or her specified assigned area and the coordination of compliance reporting to the Compliance Department.

Job Duties

  • Liaise with both internal and external customers with level of due diligence to ensure return of consignment assets.
  • Generating compliance invoices for failure to return units associated with billable consignment event agreements.
  • Reversing manual invoices when asset is returned within designated timeframe.
  • Transferring ownership when invoices are paid. data for accuracy, make corrections and notify Supervisor about escalated issues and discrepancies.
  • Utilize FedEx' s tracking system to set up and follow up on the return shipment of asset units.
  • Act as point of contact for Sales, Marketing, Consignment event owners when assistance is needed on certain retrieval issues (e.g., customer non- compliance with the return of overdue equipment).
  • Respond to all phone calls and e- mails from internal and external customers within 24 hours.
  • Provide copies of agreements and supporting  information to Sales and Marketing upon request.
  • Resolve procedure- reporting issues, recommend and take appropriate actions on discrepancies to resolve issues.
  • Resolve or direct Sales Reps to appropriate contacts on any issue.
  • Initiate and consistently communicate our collection process following guidelines, policies, and procedures for all delinquent consignment returns within assigned area.
  • Reduce delinquency of outstanding assets at accounts in assigned portfolio.
  • Follow set guidelines for resolving disputed freight claims with Supply Chain.
  • Document policy violations found and escalate to Compliance  team, as necessary.
  • Perform other related duties as assigned.

Job Qualifications

Required:

High School Diploma plus four years of customer service or collections experience required OR Associates Degree plus two years of customer service or collections experience OR Bachelor's Degree - Business Major

Job Description

The Executive Director, Financial Services is responsible for leading, planning, and managing all operational functions to drive operational excellence, minimizing costs while optimizing customer service, experience, and revenues for FIS (Financial Services).  This position guides the formulation and implementation of company policies regarding our leasing business and ensures that methods and procedures employed are efficient and are accepted within legal and corporate guidelines.  Responsible for guiding and directing management in development, production and promotion of Olympus products and services and for the leadership of operational and technology activities.

Job Duties

  • Provide direct management and oversight to reporting staff in Operations for the life of the lease activities by developing a strong team (s) proficient in contract preparation, customer service and contract life cycle management. This is to include small, and mid/large ticket corporate discipline transactions, ensuring that efficient production is in place.
  • Develop, monitor, and manage asset management policies, procedures, and asset valuation in partnership with Finance to maintain and enhance our residual value positions for future growth
  • Managing all leasing transactions and monitor the leasing portfolio in accordance with performance and quality standard defined by Generally Accepted Accounting Procedures (GAAP) Federal & State taxation regulations, along with all applicable Olympus business polices.
  • Owns the leasing customer experience, polices and guidelines for all leasing transactional touchpoints to reduce financial risk and maximize profitability.  This is done by ensuring cross functional polices are embedded within all business units to include :  Marketing, Sales Management, Customer Service, Order Entry, Credit, Collections, Tax, Legal, Accounting and Finance (Billing & Invoicing) and Asset Retrieval
  • Establish, monitor progress against, and ensure delivery of customer SLA’s, KPI and quality assurance targets, keeping the customer experience in all that we do.  Establish customer NPS targets and support business maturity through customer data.
  • Monitor and report on non-financial risks as well and ensure remediation plans are implemented and followed.
  • Improve, and implement financial, accounting and administrate processes, procedures and internal controls aligned with Finance and Accounting requirements
  • Provides guidance and oversight in the identification and selection of FIS end-to-end systems and system requirement for all leasing applications.  This is to include internal and external facing applications.  Ensuring the successful integration of technology solutions with efficient and frictionless processes for our customers.
  • Responsible for managing of IT daily support activities
  • Manage all applicable outsourcing relationships and serves as contact in supporting our external clients/vendors/customers
  • Ensuring that cross training and development of staff offers opportunities for development and growth by creating succession planning, so our members are best positioned for the workplace of the future.

Job Qualifications

Required:

  • Bachelor’s degree required, with focus on accounting or finance preferred.
  • Minimum of 15 years relevant experience in high volume transactional operations with at least 10 years of people management responsibility in the equipment leasing environment.
  • Knowledge or current RPA/DL and AI technologies and implementations.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and applications of Lean and Six Sigma practices in a transactional setting.
  • Language skills (verbal written listening) software skills, analytical skills, mathematical skills, presentation skills and a team player. Good oral and written communication skills. Experience in working with MS Word Excel Showcase and other office based PC programs.
  • Hours outside of normal operations required.
  • Travel less than 10% as needed.

Preferred:

  • Experience with leading cross-functional teams preferred.
  • Demonstrated change leader with a track record in managing large/complex change projects and continuous improvement initiatives.
  • Experience with complex IT change projects preferred.
  • Highly organized with strong time management skills
  • Government contract experience a plus.

Job Description

Provides equipment training, clinical case support, education, as well as knowledge and expertise in the sale and marketing of Ultrasound products and to the improvement of those products.

Job Duties

  • Assists the sales organization in demonstrating and selling all ultrasound products by providing the technical expertise of ultrasound
  • Provides the technical expertise in installation of customer products and provides extended on-site support and/or training to customers as appropriate after installation
  • Troubleshoots, identifies and corrects as possible and appropriate, any equipment related adjustments, functions, or problems. First tries to troubleshoot over the phone prior to going on site. Initiates Technical Support, repair or other appropriate response to any issue beyond the Specialist’s clinical expertise.
  • Provides training to Olympus personnel as required, using appropriate training materials and methods to support the Sales Training and/or Marketing Departments.
  • Supports customer education courses and activities related to the clinical usage of ultrasound products.  Participates at meetings, shows, and conventions as required, to demonstrate and promote ultrasound products.
  • Reports any problems, needs, ideas, etc. related to product and or techniques to the appropriate Product or R&D Manager.
  • Maintains working relationships with all levels of the sales organization and other support functions, such as customer service and repair, operations, field service engineering and administration.
  • Establishes and maintains relationships with physicians, nursing management and personnel and other associated personnel at the customer level.
  • Develops and maintains effective knowledge of competitive products and provides input to management.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.

Job Qualifications

Required:

  • Registered Diagnostic Medical Sonographer, RDMS required. Radiology Technologist, RT(R) a plus. Maintains all certification and/or registrations.
  • Registered in at least two modalities, one of which should be Abdominal (others may include Vascular, Cardiac, OB/GYN, etc.)
  • Previous business experience in product demonstration, installation, and usage instruction
  • Minimum of three years clinical applications experience in ultrasound.
  • Must be able to travel extensively.

Preferred:

  • Bachelor’s degree in related field preferred
  • Gastroenterology background useful and preferred.
  • Ability to effectively communicate and educate physicians, nursing and sales personnel essential
  • High level of personal organization
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • High level of customer interaction and customer service support
  • Independent work ethic
  • Individual and team oriented
  • Consistently exceeds customer satisfaction and expectations of both internal and external customers

Why join Olympus?

  • Competitive salaries, annual bonus and 401(k)* with company match
  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Visions coverage effective on start date
  • 24/7 Employee Assistance Program

  • Work-life balance supportive culture with hybrid and remote roles
  • 12 Paid Holidays
  • Educational Assistance
  • Parental Leave and Adoption Assistance
  • Volunteering and charitable donation match programs

  • On-Site Child Daycare, Café, Fitness Center**

Job Description

The Field Service Engineer (FSE) services and maintains all product lines for Olympus America medical products. Under minimal supervision, the FSE will service and provide expert level technical support to assigned equipment.

Job Duties

  • Establish and maintain a high level of customer satisfaction with assigned products, support, and service
  • Respond to customer inquiries, maintain a good customer service reputation by complying with all regulatory requirements and all aspects of company quality system
  • Train customers on the basic operation and use of assigned products
  • Provide feedback concerning product questions, workflow issues, performance anomalies encountered in the field, and make recommendations for service improvements
  • Perform new equipment installations, upgrades, post installation testing, troubleshooting and all other aspects of technical support for all assigned products.
  • Escalate customer issues and unresolved product problems to service management in a comprehensive and timely manner
  • Open communication with territory Sales Representatives
  • Provide support at conventions, trade shows and customer trial
  • Assist in the planning of Endoscopy/Surgical room video and audio cabling and other special projects as directed
  • Prepare train and mentor level 1 field service engineers as necessary
  • Establishes, develops, or maintains field contact with key customers, clinicians and researchers, and other decision makers in assigned accounts including travel to customer facilities and onsite support. Employees must adhere to all customer vendor credentialing requirements when visiting medical facilities

Job Qualifications

Required:

  • Associates Degree in electronics, computer science or related technical discipline is required. Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent Military technical training.
  • Minimum three years as a Field Service Engineer, or equivalent experience.
  • Experience in field service, project management and or sales support.
  • Proficient in technical issue management.
  • Demonstrated project management experience with video, computer and or electronic product installations.
  • Experience working with and troubleshooting electromechanical / microprocessor-based products
  • Must always hold a valid U.S. Driver’s License that is not revoked or suspended in any state, province or other jurisdiction.
  • Ability to travel overnight (>60%)
  • Ability to work flexible hours as required including weekends

Preferred:

  • CompTIA Net+ or CompTIA A+ or other similar industry recognized certification is preferred
  • Working knowledge of networking, hospital information systems, and DICOM or PACS systems is desirable
  • Experience working with and troubleshooting video display and video routing systems is desirable
  • Experienced user of Microsoft Office tools, including Excel, Word, and Power Point.
  • Strong customer service skills.
  • Solid working knowledge of electronics, personal computer hardware and software
  • Proven ability to work under pressure.
  • Ability to articulate technical and user needs in a concise manner easily understood by all.
  • Ability to work with field personnel, management, and customers.
  • Demonstrated decision-making ability towards solving problems, and effectively communicate these solutions to co‑workers and customers

Job Description

Support creation and implementation of marketing plan including to organize design and execute product & soft skill sales training to grow GIE/ET business in OLA territory. Provide constant presence in the ﬁeld to enhance company image and help Achieve short and long term business unit objectives.

Job Duties

  • Support creation and implementation of Marketing Plan for the segmentation sale and promotion of medical products (GIE & ET) to OLA territory to achieve stated short and long range business unit objectives.
  • Collaborate to develop and maintain territory customer database as well as competitive database.
  • Collaborate with distributors country managers general manger by getting direction & alignment from BU leader for any activities Attend trade shows as necessary to demonstrate Olympus equipment and meet with potential and current customers.
  • Attend seminars and sales meetings in order to develop knowledge about BU's products and procedures.
  • Prepare all training material and practice with medical equipment/devices (GIE & ET) up to a deep level to serve as a professional guidance and specialist to the end users before during and after procedures.
  • Help the training team organize design and conduct all MP (GIE & ET) product training for OLA distributors.
  • Present evaluation report to end user for signature and comments on equipment demonstrated.
  • Be on time on every appointed procedure/demonstration to prepare all Olympus device.
  • Be vigilant of all Olympus equipment to preserve in good conditions and provide training to end user on how to handle equipment with care.
  • Practice accounts regulations and behavior at all times (appropriate dressing proper communication and conversation during procedures for consulting or product guidance only) preparation before and after procedures.
  • Conﬁdentiality of all information learned from hospitals clinics private oﬃces personnel and patients.
  • Demonstrations Evaluation &In-service: provide support for Demo/Eval and In-service upon request from customers & distributors.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.

Job Qualifications

Required:

  • Bachelor's degree preferably in science or equivalent knowledge.
  • Minimum of 10 years related experience.
  • Medical procedures experience in a hospital.

Job Description

The Field Service Engineer (FSE) services and maintains all product lines for Olympus America medical products. Under minimal supervision, the FSE will service and provide expert level technical support to assigned equipment.

Job Duties

  • Establish and maintain a high level of customer satisfaction with assigned products, support, and service
  • Respond to customer inquiries, maintain a good customer service reputation by complying with all regulatory requirements and all aspects of company quality system
  • Train customers on the basic operation and use of assigned products
  • Provide feedback concerning product questions, workflow issues, performance anomalies encountered in the field, and make recommendations for service improvements
  • Perform new equipment installations, upgrades, post installation testing, troubleshooting and all other aspects of technical support for all assigned products.
  • Escalate customer issues and unresolved product problems to service management in a comprehensive and timely manner
  • Open communication with territory Sales Representatives
  • Provide support at conventions, trade shows and customer trial
  • Assist in the planning of Endoscopy/Surgical room video and audio cabling and other special projects as directed
  • Prepare train and mentor level 1 field service engineers as necessary
  • Establishes, develops, or maintains field contact with key customers, clinicians and researchers, and other decision makers in assigned accounts including travel to customer facilities and onsite support. Employees must adhere to all customer vendor credentialing requirements when visiting medical facilities

Job Qualifications

Required:

  • Associates Degree in electronics, computer science or related technical discipline is required. Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent Military technical training.
  • Minimum three years as a Field Service Engineer, or equivalent experience.
  • Experience in field service, project management and or sales support.
  • Proficient in technical issue management.
  • Demonstrated project management experience with video, computer and or electronic product installations.
  • Experience working with and troubleshooting electromechanical / microprocessor-based products.
  • Must always hold a valid U.S. Driver’s License that is not revoked or suspended in any state, province or other jurisdiction.
  • Ability to travel overnight (>60%).
  • Ability to work flexible hours as required including weekends.


Preferred:

  • Working knowledge of networking, hospital information systems, and DICOM or PACS systems is desirable.
  • Experience working with and troubleshooting video display and video routing systems is desirable.
  • CompTIA Net+ or CompTIA A+ or other similar industry recognized certification is preferred
  • Experienced user of Microsoft Office tools, including Excel, Word, and Power Point.
  • Strong customer service skills.
  • Solid working knowledge of electronics, personal computer hardware and software
  • Proven ability to work under pressure.
  • Ability to articulate technical and user needs in a concise manner easily understood by all.
  • Ability to work with field personnel, management, and customers.
  • Demonstrated decision-making ability towards solving problems, and effectively communicate these solutions to co-workers and customers

Job Description:
Working Location: MASSACHUSETTS, WESTBOROUGH

Are you looking for a company that cares about people’s lives and health, including yours? Let’s inspire healthier lives, together.

Job Description

The Senior Manager, Strategic Marketing is a key member of the global Urology / Gynecology Strategic Marketing team. He/She plays a critical role in Strategic Business & Long-Range Financial Planning processes, in addition to Patient Care Pathway and North-Star activities for the global business unit. This individual also has responsibility for identifying new growth and global expansion opportunities for the business unit, with a focus on adjacencies and inorganic (business development / M&A) opportunities. They will collaborate with peers across the globe on market research and analysis and will lead initiatives to drive our business objectives.

Job Duties

  • Maintain a comprehensive understanding of customer needs, market trends, competitive landscape, technology trends, identification, and assessment of significant growth opportunities.
  • Support the Business Unit Strategy Leader in the strategic and financial planning processes such as Strategic Business Planning and Long-Range Planning, or key deliverables / workstreams within those processes, on behalf of the business unit to create the vision and mission and layout the overall Global Portfolio Strategy and Strategic 5-year plan to successfully achieve targets.
  • Serve as global business unit representative on task forces and other projects as assigned, such as development of patient care pathways and north star long-term strategy.
  • Partner with product portfolio leads to develop strategies for therapeutic growth pillars, inclusive of competitive intelligence reporting and execution of market research activities to drive business portfolio decisions.
  • Identify and engage with Healthcare Professionals (HCPs) as appropriate to inform around market and customer needs.
  • Analyze market data to develop insights, identify trends, and establish a roadmap of actions to capitalize on identified opportunities.  Partner closely with the Global Market Intelligence team to ensure that the right market data and competitive landscape assessments are available for the segment specifically and that there is a plan to fill gaps for key areas of focus (product segments) in all key regions of existing business and planned expansion.
  • Develop a strong understanding of global markets inclusive of market opportunity, market trends, unique customer & market needs, purchasing entities / processes, and Olympus presence / capabilities.
  • Partner closely with cross-functional teams across the organization and drive influence on behalf of the global business unit.
  • Maintain expertise by attending procedures, courses, workshops, tradeshows, and staying abreast of market dynamics, competitive landscape and global industry changes and technological advancements.
  • Perform all other duties as assigned.

Job Qualifications

Required:

  • Bachelor's degree required in relevant field, Masters or MBA preferred.
  • Minimum 5 years of experience within medical devices, diagnostics, and/or pharmaceuticals
  • Minimum 6 years of business experience is required (ideal candidate will have a blend of new product development, marketing product innovation, upstream marketing and/or downstream marketing)
  • Ability to travel domestically and internationally.

Preferred:

  • Sales and/or marketing experience in a regional commercial organization in a medical device organization is highly preferred.
  • Experience in strategy management consulting or similar, preferred.
  • Good negotiating, problem solving and project management skills.
  • Excellent written and oral communication and presentation skills.
  • Skilled at managing through influence.

Job Title: Executive Director, Global Distribution Quality- Remote
Job Description:
Working Location: MASSACHUSETTS, WESTBOROUGH; NATIONWIDE

Workplace Flexibility: Field

Are you looking for a company that cares about people’s lives and health, including yours? Let’s inspire healthier lives, together.

Olympus, a leading medical technology company, has focused on making people’s lives better for over 100 years.

Job Description

The Executive Director of Quality Process Improvement - Distribution will be responsible for establishing, maintaining, and continuously improving the Quality Management System for both Olympus distribution sites and the requirements of our third-party distributors. This role will focus on developing and implementing efficient, harmonized quality processes compliant with global regulatory requirements. In working with regional (Americas, EMEA, Japan, APAC) Distribution Quality leaders they will ensure execution of customer requirements within the boundaries of the quality processes. This role will also serve as a subject matter expert for the quality process controls needed for the distribution value stream and serve as the Global Process Owner (GPO) for the Product Ship Hold process. The Executive Director of Quality Process Improvement - Distribution will report to the VP of Global Product Distribution Quality, and work collaboratively with other functions such as Supply Chain Management (SCM), Service, Sales, Market Quality, and Regulatory Affairs to achieve organizational objectives.

Job Duties

  • Develop and implement a quality management system and processes governing distribution and ensure consistent, compliant, and efficient execution.
  • Serve as or manage the team accountable for Distribution quality process ownership across a global scope.
  • Foster and maintain a customer-focused quality mindset throughout the organization.
  • Oversee the Global Ship Hold process by collaborating with the Regional Quality, Manufacturing, Service & Repair and Corporate Field Corrective Action teams.
  • Establish, track and trend metrics to ensure QMS effectiveness. Including governance and execution of the Management Review requirements for distribution.
  • Lead programs to improve systems and processes to consistently meet or exceed regulatory & customer requirements.
  • Drive data-driven approaches to identify areas of quality risk and customer dissatisfaction, initiate appropriate corrective actions/ preventive actions to ensure effective and timely resolution commensurate with risk.
  • Assist Regional Distribution Quality leaders to ensure audit and inspection readiness.
  • Provide quality and compliance expertise and guidance to Distribution and Supply Chain colleagues globally.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Job Qualifications

Required:

  • A BA/BS degree or equivalent in a Life Science, Engineering, or Physical Science.
  • A minimum of 12 years of experience in quality management or compliance functions within the MedTech industry. Strong understanding of Distribution requirements across global regions.
  • Demonstrated comprehensive expertise in the interpretation and application of FDA regulations and other global regulations & standards governing CGMPs.
  • Proven experience in designing, implementing, and improving quality systems and metrics.
  • Set / deliver to global quality objectives/KPIs, reviews and assesses ongoing performance of direct reports as well as ‘dotted line’ reports (as may be required).
  • Willingness to travel international up to 25-50% of the time and work outside of normal business hours to support global business operations.

Preferred:

  • Advanced technical degree and MBA preferred.
  • Proactive approach to quality and compliance, with a focus on innovation and adaptation in a fast-paced environment.
  • Experience with LEAN/Six Sigma is preferred to drive process discipline in this global role.
  • Strong ability to think and act globally, be a fearless change agent while managing risks, develop future visions and engage broad audiences to drive transformation.
  • Capable of presenting clear and insightful thoughts based in facts and data, gain trust, build confidence and influence key stakeholders across the business.
  • Persistence to continuously improve, never settling for status quo, while keeping customer satisfaction and customer value central.
  • Establish, manage, coach and develop a high performing team that meets agreed objectives on time and on budget, while delivering best practice results, added value and continuous improvement.

Job Description:

Job Description

The Sr. Manager, Business Development Quality Assurance will support Quality Assurance M&A activities throughout the project lifecycle. This role will participate in due diligence of targets and identification of potential compliance risks which could impact the business. The Sr. Manager will identify resourcing and budgeting needs to effectively mitigate the identified risks. This role also participates in transition service planning, integration planning, and integration execution post-close to ensure a smooth transition and integration into Olympus Quality System occurs. This role will be responsible for development of Integration Quality Plans, training, and execution to those plans which requires close collaboration with the Quality Assurance sub­functions.

Job Duties

  • Perform due diligence and communicate Quality Assurance risks associated with the target.
  • Define and evaluate compliance risks and develop mitigation plans to address the risks.
  • Identify resourcing and budgeting needs to appropriately mitigate risks; communicate these needs to the Quality Assurance BD Lead & BD core team members to be included within the deal model to ensure effective execution of risk mitigation activities.
  • Develop quality plans for integration into the Olympus Quality Management System following M&A.
  • Train the integration team to the execution of integration quality plans
  • Support the functional integration leaders during integration planning and execution.
  • Utilize the BD playbook to develop Quality integration plans and communicate suggestions for continuous improvement.
  • Work cross functionally with Olympus team members supporting Business Development activities to ensure system integration.
  • Build and maintain a network of resources in all regions, across all businesses and divisions.
  • Integrate the target site into the Olympus quality culture and ensure cohesive transition into full integration. Stay up to date on the latest global regulations.
  • Collaborate closely with the Quality, Regulatory, R&D, Business Development, Medical & Scientific Affairs, IT, and Operations functions.
  • Other BD project related tasks and deliverables as determined by the Quality Assurance BD Lead.

Job Qualifications

Required:

  • Minimum requirements are a BA/BS degree or equivalent in Engineering or Physical Science with an advanced technical degree and/or MBA preferred.
  • Minimum of 10 years of Quality Assurance experience in the Pharmaceutical or Medical Device industry (Medical Device preferred).
  • Strong prior experience in Quality Assurance initiatives including post market surveillance, complaints management, quality KPls, Design Controls, Risk management, CAPA, Quality Management Review, Audits, and Supplier Quality.
  • Demonstrated comprehensive expertise in the applied interpretation of worldwide regulatory standards and laws applicable to the medical device industry such as: ISO, QSR, GMP, GLP.
  • Experience in Business Development M&A projects including due diligence, integration planning, and project management.
  • Travel: Position requires up to 20% travel both domestic and international.
  • Experienced in strategic planning and risk management.
  • The ability to lead remote teams in both global and regional environments.
  • Experience in Business Development M&A projects including due diligence, integration planning, and project management.

Preferred:

  • Excellent written and oral communication and organizational skills.
  • Ability to adapt to a changing environment.
  • Strong analytical, multitasking, time management, and organizational skills with focused attention on detail.

Job Description:
Working Location: MASSACHUSETTS, WESTBOROUGH

Workplace Flexibility: Hybrid

Are you looking for a company that cares about people’s lives and health, including yours? Let’s inspire healthier lives, together.

Olympus, a leading medical technology company, has focused on making people’s lives better for over 100 years.

Our Purpose is to make people’s lives healthier, safer, and more fulfilling.

Our Core Values are reflected in all we do: Integrity – Empathy – Agility – Unity – Long-Term View

We deliver on our purpose and our core values by staying True to Life.

Job Description

Olympus ambition is to extend its strong value proposition with digital solutions. The vision is to shape the future with an Intelligent Endoscopy Ecosystem, enabled by a modern software platform and connectivity solution. To deliver to this vision, build a solution-centric operating model and embrace new ways of working, the Digital Unit DU (R&D) & Endoscopy Solutions Ecosystem Unit ESE (Commercial) were established.

This position plays a pivotal role in driving operational excellence and facilitating seamless agile and cross-functional collaboration within the Digital Unit and Endoscopy Solutions Ecosystem (DU/ESE) and with key stakeholders from other Business Units to optimize our market release quality and frequency. To achieve this, you will work closely with stakeholders across departments, leading efforts to design and implement optimal processes, operational governance structures, and meeting cadences. Your focus will be fostering efficient interaction between solutions, product, commercialization & other functional teams, ensuring alignment with overarching strategic objectives. You will report to the Global Head of Transformation Office for the Digital Unit and Endoscopy Solutions Ecosystem in this role.

Job Duties

  • Process & Governance Implementation: Work with relevant stakeholders to design and establish optimal processes, operational governance structures, and meeting cadence to ensure seamless cross-functional interaction between the solutions, product, commercialization & other functional teams and  enable successful releases of digital products and solutions.
  • Ownership for E2E Processes: Ensure clear ownership, process adherence, optimal preparation, and facilitation of all relevant events, procedures and timelines in the agile product development and commercialization process.
  • Drive Stakeholder Alignment: Ensure seamless collaboration and alignment of processes and operational governance with relevant stakeholders and teams within the ecosystem organization (ESE & DU) and with other business functions within Olympus such as Sales, Marketing, and Market Intelligence.
  • Thought Leadership: Act as a trusted advisor for key stakeholders in the organization and regularly seek input and feedback to gain insights into concerns, priorities, and pain points to optimize collaboration. Be an ambassador for cultural change towards agile, solution-oriented ways of working.
  • Manage Risks: Identify potential risks and bottlenecks within processes & governance structures and develop mitigation strategies to address them.
  • Establish Performance Tracking: Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to assess process performance and effectiveness.
  • Optimize Continuously: Continuously optimize the effectiveness of processes and governance structures while integrating external best practices for agile product development and commercialization.
  • Enable Stakeholders: Ensure that relevant stakeholders and teams are educated on the established processes, governance structures and meeting cadences.

Job Requirements

Required:

  • Bachelor or Master’s Degree (or equivalent) in Business, Engineering, or Science (focus on Digital Solutions or MedTech is a plus).
  • Successful track record and strong understanding in designing and implementing agile product development and commercialization governance frameworks, methodologies and processes to effectively build and commercialize products in an organization.
  • Demonstrated experience in managing digital operations, including process optimization, governance, and collaboration within a complex environment.
  • Expertise in leading and executing process improvement initiatives that create value, drive growth, and drive high-performance in the organization.
  • Experience in collaborating and partnering with global stakeholders in an international environment.
  • Candidate should be flexible to work outside US Office hours as project phases require
  • Candidate should be willing to travel (10-20% expected)

Preferred:

  • Certifications such as Six Sigma, Lean Six Sigma, or Business Process Management (BPM) are a plus.
  • A minimum of 10 years of professional experience in consulting, agile product management, B2B SaaS, Healthcare, or a related field preferred
  • Exposure to digital transformation in the MedTech industry is preferred.
  • Entrepreneurial mindset and the drive to collaboratively shape and build our Digital Unit & Ecosystem Unit
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, with an ability to effectively communicate complex concepts to all levels of the organization.
  • Strong analytical problem-solving skills with impeccable attention to detail.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate and build a consensus in a complex environment.
  • Solid knowledge of the commercialization process for digital products, including product launch strategies, market analysis, and business development.
  • A deep understanding of agile methodologies such as Scrum, Kanban, Lean, etc., including knowledge of agile principles, practices, and frameworks.
  • Organized and methodological working style, excellent time management.
  • Ability to effectively engage and collaborate with stakeholders at various levels, including senior leadership, product teams, commercialization teams, and other relevant departments globally.

Job Description:

Are you looking for a company that cares about people’s lives and health, including yours? Let’s inspire healthier lives, together.

Job Description

The Global Senior Product Manager, Urology will be the primary global marketing leader and subject matter expert for a critical product category within the Global Urology business unit. This individual will own financial performance & portfolio strategy for the product category while identifying & driving global expansion opportunities across the portfolio in close partnership with region commercial teams around the world.

Job Duties

  • Serve as global marketing lead for a crucial business segment within Stone Management segment of the Global Urology Business Unit
  • Serve as global product management lead for a portfolio of products that fall within the business segment and the team’s scope of responsibility.
  • Derive a deep understanding of customer requirements / user needs through formal market research and procedural expertise.
  • Collaborate with region commercial teams to ensure that sellers around the world have clear, consistent, evidence-backed messaging and the tools/programs they need to clearly communicate value propositions to theircustomers.
  • Collaborate with global supply chain, manufacturing, and external suppliers to ensure accurate forecasting &strong product supply.
  • Devise the portfolio strategy to ensure sustainable growth and long-term market leadership and collaborate with internal & external partners to execute programs to expand & optimize the product offering.
  • Plan & execute lifecycle management activities to ensure appropriate balance between launch of new products& obsolescence of older offerings.
  • Identify market expansion opportunities to grow the business segment both in existing and emerging regions/geographies.

Job Qualification

Required:

  • Bachelor’s degree required with a major in Marketing, Business or related field; MBA preferred.
  • Minimum 5 years global marketing or business development experience in the field of medical devices.
  • Ability to travel up to 35%

Preferred:

  • Deep understanding of market access tactics and healthcare economic value principles for medical devices.
  • Documented and successful experience developing markets for new medical device technologies.
  • Excellent interpersonal, written communications and organizational skills.

Are you looking for a company that cares about people’s lives and health, including yours? Let’s inspire healthier lives, together.

Job Description

The Field Service Engineer (FSE) services and maintains all product lines for Olympus America medical products. Under supervision of Manager and Senior FSE Trainer, the FSE will service and provide expert level technical support to assigned equipment.

Job Duties

  • Establish and maintain a high level of customer satisfaction with assigned products, support and service
  • Respond to customer inquiries, maintain a good customer service reputation by complying with all regulatory requirements and all aspects of company quality system
  • Train customers on the basic operation and use of assigned products
  • Provide feedback concerning product questions, workflow issues, performance anomalies encountered in the field, and make recommendations for service improvements
  • Perform new equipment installations, upgrades, post installation testing, troubleshooting and all other aspects of technical support for all assigned products.
  • Escalate customer issues and unresolved product problems to service management in a comprehensive and timely manner
  • Open communication with territory Sales Representatives
  • Provide support at conventions, trade shows and customer trials
  • Establishes, develops, or maintains field contact with key customers, clinicians and researchers, and other decision makers in assigned accounts including travel to customer facilities and onsite support. Employees must adhere to all customer vendor credentialing requirements when visiting medical facilities

Job Qualifications

Required:

  • Associates Degree in electronics, computer science or related technical discipline or minimum of 4 years of equivalent experience with medical devices and or Military Technical experience is required.  Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent Military technical training
  • Minimum one to three years as a Field Service Engineer, or equivalent experience
  • Experience working with and troubleshooting electromechanical / microprocessor-based products
  • Must be a self-starter, able to travel on short notice and work independently with minimal supervision
  • Must be capable of multi-tasking, setting priorities and scheduling work activities
  • Must always hold a valid U.S. Driver’s License that is not revoked or suspended in any state, province or other jurisdiction
  • Ability to travel overnight (>60%)
  • Ability to work flexible hours as required including weekends

Preferred:

  • Working knowledge of networking, hospital information systems, and DICOM or PACS systems is desirable
  • Experience working with and troubleshooting video display and video routing systems is desirable
  • CompTIA Net+ or CompTIA A+ or other similar industry recognized certification is preferred
  • Experienced user of Microsoft Office tools, including Excel, Word and Power Point.
  • Strong customer service skills.
  • Solid working knowledge of electronics, personal computer hardware and software
  • Proven ability to work under pressure.
  • Ability to articulate technical and user needs in a concise manner easily understood by all.
  • Ability to work with field personnel, management, and customers.
  • Demonstrated decision-making ability towards solving problems, and effectively communicate these solutions to co‑workers and customers

Job Description:
Working Location: ONTARIO, RICHMOND HILL

Workplace Flexibility: Onsite

Are you looking for a company that cares about people’s lives and health, including yours? Let’s inspire healthier lives, together.

Olympus, a leading medical technology company, has focused on making people’s lives better for over 100 years.

Our Purpose is to make people’s lives healthier, safer, and more fulfilling.

Our Core Values are reflected in all we do: Integrity – Empathy – Agility – Unity – Long-Term View

We deliver on our purpose and our core values by staying True to Life.

Job Description

The OCI Endoscope Technician I must understand and accept the responsibility to ensure the safety of all Olympus products that are repaired by following established processes and procedures. The incumbent shall evaluate troubleshoot disassemble assemble repair and/or inspect Endoscopes Electronics or Microscopy products to assure proper function.

Job Duties

  • Repair duties will mostly focus on minor repair of large diameter endoscopes and may be involved in large diameter sequential production line repairs. May also be involved in mixing of glue data recording calibration and cleaning of common areas.
  • Follow established procedures on routine work according to Olympus online repair manual (ES-Web).
  • May be required to rotate through different parts of the repair department to ensure proper understanding of the products and the different repairs and inspection techniques.
  • Meet or exceed repair and quality standard times
  • Apply acquired skills related to the repair and service of endoscopes electronics or Microscopes products and participate/train in the quality systems quality improvement and 5S programs as directed by Supervisors.
  • Perform all other related duties as assigned.

Job Qualifications

Required :

  • High School Diploma is required 0-1 year experience in technical repairs with mechanical or electronic equipment preferred
  • Repair experience in the medical or health care industry preferred
  • Expected to maintain acceptable standards for attendance and punctuality and as a condition of employment work overtime as needed EOE M/F/DN

Preferred :

  • Must possess basic computer skills
  • Must be able to demonstrate skill in disassembly assembly repair quality inspection or equivalent in precision repair activity while maintaining productivity and quality.
  • Must have sufficient manual dexterity with small hand tools (such as screwdrivers electric screwdrivers pliers or tweezers) and test equipment to make repairs and facilitate disassembly and reassembly.
  • Experience or ability to hand soldering is essential.
  • Ability to read and follow manuals work instructions job standards and related information is required.
  • Must be customer focused/oriented.
  • Must demonstrate the ability to maintain acceptable levels of quality and productivity as acquired through technical training.
  • Ability to follow work instructions per Supervisors Quality Assurance Inspector Sr Technical Trainer or Production Coordinator as assigned.
  • Hepatitis B vaccination is recommended for employees who are at risk for exposure to blood or other bodily fluids on the job.
  • Service responsibilities include the handling of products and equipment that may have potentially come into contact with blood or bodily fluids. OCI requires that all employees working in areas that may be exposed to these risk either provide proof of the Twinrix (Hepatitis A and B) vaccination or sign a waiver accepting the possible risk of exposure from not being vaccinated. If you have severe allergies or ever had a severe allergic reaction to a vaccine please seek medical advice before taking this vaccine

Job Title: US Market Access and Reimbursement Senior Analyst
Job Description:
Working Location: MASSACHUSETTS, WESTBOROUGH; PENNSYLVANIA, CENTER VALLEY

Workplace Flexibility: Field

Are you looking for a company that cares about people’s lives and health, including yours? Let’s inspire healthier lives, together.

Olympus, a leading medical technology company, has focused on making people’s lives better for over 100 years.

Our Purpose is to make people’s lives healthier, safer, and more fulfilling.

Our Core Values are reflected in all we do: Integrity – Empathy – Agility – Unity – Long-Term View

We deliver on our purpose and our core values by staying True to Life.

Job Description

This position is a US corporate position responsible for reimbursement monitoring in matters related to coding, payment and coverage trends for the Olympus upstream and downstream portfoliossupporting the assigned business unit(s).  The candidate will provide guidance to internal business units about reimbursement challenges and opportunities and working on potential reimbursement pathways to secure or optimize reimbursement. This person will also assist in the development of tools and programs to educate customer and expand US market access by means of reimbursement.

Job Duties

  • Analyze US reimbursement trends including coding changes, payment amounts,  fees schedules, coverage status impacting upstream and downstream Olympus procedures and products.
  • Independently develop reimbursement collateral materials to support Olympus customers based on strategic HEMA plan
  • Educate each business unit a new evolving reimbursement trends and implications
  • Analyze secondary data for both Medicare and commercial payers related to reimbursement, charges payment
  • Provide strategic direction in the development of reimbursement tools and materials to support successful market access education with customers
  • Provide US reimbursement education to upstream and downstream marketing so they may have a foundation for reimbursement to guide their decision-making.
  • Leads reimbursement sales training efforts both new hire and advanced training
  • Manage reimbursement database that allows tracking of B/U important Medicare reimbursement trends. Update and present to business units regarding changes to Medicare in proposed and final payment rules
  • Participate and monitor results of AMA CPT coding meeting and CMS open reimbursement forums
  • Duties as assigned

Job Qualifications

Required:

  • Bachelor’s degree is required and a concentration in health policy or business is preferred  or equivalent professional experience
  • Strong understanding of reimbursement and market dynamic from a US perspective; gained from a minimum of 3 years experience in billing/coding/reimbursement
  • Minimum of 2-3 years’ experience in working with medical device company to support reimbursement and/or other financial areas is required
  • Manage projects with minimal guidance.
  • 10%-15% travel as needed

Preferred:

  • Proficiency in ACCESS and advanced excel; MS Office 365
  • Ability to distill complex regulations and trends into a simple message
  • Strong communication skills
  • Self starter; ability to work independently
  • Business acumen in working with and interpreting financial information and trends
  • Strong customer focus responds promptly to customer questions and requests; effectively manages customer expectations
  • Approaches work in an organized and systematic way; able to prioritize and manage multiple projects

Are you looking for a company that cares about people’s lives and health, including yours? Let’s inspire healthier lives, together.

Job Description

This position supports production objectives to improve quality, cost, and delivery.  Will work closely with Production and Operations to evaluate, recommend and implement shop floor process improvement activities. This position will function as a team member on more complicated projects as defined by the Engineering Manager, and will provide technical information to other project participants/cross functional teams, recommend cost-effective procedures, track and maintain implementation dates. This position will assist with the continuous improvement of the endoscope service business as a whole.

Job Duties

  • Interact with production teams to provide product support, including but not limited to implementing process improvements, troubleshooting equipment, addressing process questions, setting up KanBans and aiding capacity planning.
  • Ability to lead routine projects without assistance.
  • Mentor junior engineers.
  • Process change orders (CO).
  • Verify/create bill of materials, routers, and labor codes.
  • Assist in addressing Corrective Actions (CA).
  • Execute process and equipment validations (IQ/OQ/PQ).
  • Perform line audits to assure that manufacturing processes and related documentation follow established policies and procedures.
  • Review manuals for new and existing products.
  • Own manufacturing procedures to ensure control of product/process design.
  • Participate in discussions to resolve technical issues or process/product improvements
  • Coordinate cost reduction initiatives.
  • Assist in the justification for capital expenditures.
  • Develop and modify repair and refurbishment processes, tooling, and fixtures utilizing best practice tools that result in sufficient capacity to meet customer demand while promoting product quality, process efficiency and control, and operator safety.
  • Perform training for new and existing machines and processes.
  • Assist in the preparation of preventative maintenance documentation and plans.
  • Assist in identifying equipment needs and evaluate internal/external options for sourcing such equipment.
  • Assist with facilities layout including equipment layout and workplace design.
  • Apply Lean tools such as value stream map, Takt time, Ishikawa cause and effect, line balancing, Poka-yoke, identifying muda.
  • Participate in and help coordinate NPI and NPR projects.
  • All other essential duties as directed.

Job Qualification

Required:

  • Requires a bachelor's degree in engineering and a minimum of two years Engineering experience, or
  • Associate degree in engineering or engineering technology and five years related service experience, or
  • the equivalent combination of education and experience.

Preferred:

  • Utilize analytical tools, including statistic methodology, to identify design, process, and production problems.
  • Quality and customer oriented.
  • Experience in coordinating activities among departments or groups.
  • Possess a high degree of personal organization and excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office.
  • Able to perform required duties with minimal supervision.
  • Knowledge of FDA regulations is desirable.

Job Description

The SVP of Corporate Strategy will be responsible for serving on behalf of the CEO and the Global Executive Committee to develop the holistic Corporate Strategy across Olympus. This includes the Corporate Strategic Plan CSP for a 5 year term inclusive of Divisional Business Strategies, Functional and Regional Strategies with associated financials. The position will report directly to the Chief Strategy Officer.

As a newly focused Global MedTech Olympus current Corporate Strategic Planning process is fragmented. Our strong ambition to Elevate the Standard of Care in diseases of focus must be well mapped and aligned with our operational plans and investments at every level of the organization. As our head strategist, this individual will be tasked to shape the vision and cascade it down effectively to the entire organization. This will include designing the future vision for a holistic annual Corporate Strategic and Portfolio Management Process that will establish our mid and long term key areas of focus and investment.

This individual will directly lead the Global Strategy, Divisional Strategy & Portfolio Management Team,  and the Global Target Operating Model (GTOM) Excellence and Delivery team. The GTOM effort is an has a mandate as integral enabler of the Corporate Strategy coordinating efforts around organizational design, enabling skills, capabilities and technologies, governance and business processes across Divisions, Functions, and Regions.

Job Duties

  • Recruit, develop and retain talent within the Corporate Strategy team and sub functions to minimize the reliance on external consulting & amplify functional and regional skills.
  • Responsible for the design and development of the Corporate Strategy Annual Process and effective transfer of the process and governance to Corporate Planning team once in-flight.
  • In collaboration with CFO team develop the financial process linkages and tools to effectively stand up and scale the linkage to the 5-year strategic plan & annual Corporate Portfolio Management Process.
  • Directs and leads the Global Target Operating Model team empowered to lead companywide consistent efforts around org design, governance, process, capabilities and tools.
  • In collaboration with the Global Head of Business Development, establish mechanisms to embed new business development into our Corporate Strategy cycle.
  • Consistent and proactive communication cadence with Investor Relation Team and Corporate Communications to plan input and recommendations for external milestones and events.
  • In collaboration with CFO and CSO recommend financial targets and issue key reporting metrics and dashboards to ensure alignment across the enterprise.

Job Qualifications

Required:

  • BS Degree in Engineering or Business. Advanced Business degree highly preferred.
  • Minimum of 15 years of work experience in the Medical Device Industry.
  • Proven experience in Strategic Marketing, Corporate Strategy, and Portfolio Management
  • Strong preference given to a candidate with multi-function experience including business development and downstream marketing.

Preferred:

  • Must demonstrate strategic capabilities with strengths in critical thinking and innovative problem solving skills; financial and strategic.
  • Strong people leadership skills with a track record of effectively managing cross functional and multi-site teams.
  • Excellent communication skills including the ability to persuasively deliver presentations to all levels of the organization.
  • Excellent decision making skills.
  • Proven ability to collaborate and negotiate across functions and with all levels of the organization with experience and the ability to drive and influence change.
  • Ability to manage multiple departments, initiatives and competing priorities in a fast-paced, ever-changing and evolving work environment.
  • Ability to travel domestically and internationally 30% of the time.
  • Experience working in a global organization across multiple cultures is a plus.
